comment: I have to make another observation here. I started playing 6.Bg5 here when I was less than 1400 rated, and my reasons for choosing it had nothing to do with the considerations that might be relavent to me today. However for a very long time I persisted in playing it exclusively, because it became the only line that I knew, and the disparity grew with every game that I played it again. I think that this is a common problem in the way that amateurs choose their opening repertoire.
reasoning: The comment explains the mistake made by the player as it provides insight into their decision-making process, showing that their choice of the move was based on habit rather than sound strategic reasons, which contributed to their loss.
